DOC.brief_summary: This is a 6-week study treatment to evaluate the safety and effectiveness of AZD2066 in patients with major depressive disorder.
DOC.brief_title: 6-week Study Treatment to Evaluate the Safety and Effectiveness of AZD2066 in Patients With Major Depressive Disorder
DOC.detailed_description: A Phase IIa, Multi-centre, Randomized, Double-Blind, Double-Dummy, Active and Placebo Controlled, parallel Group Study to Assess the Efficacy and Safety of AZD2066 after 6 weeks of treatment in Patients with Major Depressive Disorder - D0475C00020.
DOC.criteria: Provision of signed, written, and dated Informed Consent Documented primary clinical diagnosis of Major Depressive Disorder Patients with a secondary psychiatric disorder including bipolar disorder, psychotic disorders (i.e. schizophrenia, schizoaffective disorder, depression with psychotic features), GAD and social anxiety disorder Patients whose current episode of depression started less than 4 weeks before enrollment History of inadequate response of antidepressants during current depressive episode
